choices.text:
in python calculate the average and standard deviation of a list of numbers
To calculate the average and standard deviation of a list of numbers in Python, you can use the `statistics` module. Here's an example code snippet that demonstrates how to do this:
```python
import statistics
numbers = [10, 25, 36, 49] # replace with your own list of numbers
average = statistics.mean(numbers)
standard_deviation = statistics.stdev(numbers)
print("Average:", average)
print("Standard deviation:", standard_deviation)
```
This code imports the `statistics` module, creates a list of numbers called `numbers`, calculates their mean using the `mean()` function and stores it in the variable `average`. It also calculates their standard deviation using the `stdev()` function and stores it in the variable `standard_deviation`. Finally, it prints out both values.
